The commentary was almost unnecessary because you had the visual thing in front of you.
Again, going back, and it's certainly not drawn comparisons, but it's like watching a match.
If for some reason the sound goes, you've still got the images.
Now similarly, you are seeing the kind of pain etched on people's faces.
I suppose the commentary was something that was there, but at the same time it wouldn't have mattered a great deal if it were not.
